snippet: Scientists have confirmed that the crater where a NASA rover landed last year contained a freshwater lake about 3.5 billion years ago, around the time that life is thought to have begun on Earth.
abstract: Scientists report that Mars had large freshwater lake that may have been hospitable to life 3.5 billion years ago, around same time that life arose on Earth; findings are presented at meeting of the American Geophysical Union and published in set of six articles in journal Science.
lead_paragraph: Scientists have confirmed that the crater where a NASA rover landed last year contained a freshwater lake about 3.5 billion years ago, around the time that life is thought to have begun on Earth.

headline.main: Ancient Martian Lake May Have Supported Life
headline.print_headline: Mars Had Its Own Crater Lake
